did.unittitle: Records on the opening of Washington Park, Fort Greene, Brooklyn
did.abstract: This collection consists of a copy of the New York State Assembly's 1847 act for the opening of Washington Park in Fort Greene in the City of Brooklyn, as well as a report of the commissioners appointed under the act, which details the ownership history of the land occupied by the Park. A list of the members of the Common Council of the City of Brooklyn is also included.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. James D. Lester, date unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a copy of the New York State Assembly's 1847 act for the opening of Washington Park in Fort Greene in the City of Brooklyn, as well as a report of the commissioners appointed under the act, which details the ownership history of the land occupied by the Park. A list of the members of the Common Council of the City of Brooklyn is also included.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Washington Park was designated as a public park in the Fort Greene district of the City of Brooklyn in 1845, and the New York State Legislature officially passed an act to secure land for the Park in 1847. Designs for the improvement of the Park were made by Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux, the designers of Central and Prospect Parks, beginning in 1867. The Park was renamed Fort Greene Park in 1897.
